title: Olise relishes Trabzonspor win
body_text:
Super Falcons midfielder Chioma Olise is thrilled to have won her second game in the colours of Trabzonspor Women in the Turkish Women’s topflight thanks to a 2-0 victory over Besiktas Women on Sunday.
The former Edo Queens midfielder made her second appearance for the club as they sealed the win with two second-half goals.
Olise, who was introduced in the second half, shared her delight after the game, emphasising the team’s winning mentality.
“I’m excited about the game. We fought hard for the points and got the result we wanted. We’ll keep up the momentum without relenting and approach our next game with full spirit,” she said.
With this victory, Trabzonspor Women sit fifth on the league table with 38 points. Their next fixture is an away clash against Fatih Vatan Spor, who are currently eighth with 24 points, on Sunday, March 16.
Olise joined the Turkish Women’s Super Lig side, Trabzonspor, from Nigeria Women Football League champions Edo Queens.
The Falcons player signed a one-and-a-half-year contract with her new team and dons the jersey number 16.
Olise started her topflight journey with Royal Queens when the team gained promotion to the NWFL Premiership.
Her breakthrough came at Edo Queens, where she won the 2023/24 NWFL Premiership title with Moses Aduku’s side.
She also won the West Africa Zone Women’s Champions League title in Ivory Coast and captained the Benin City-based side to a fourth-place finish at the 2024 CAF Women’s Champions League in Morocco.
At the national team level, she represented Nigeria at the 2022 FIFA U-20 Women’s World Cup as the Falconets reached the quarter-finals.
She also made the roster for the 2024 FIFA U-20 Women’s World Cup in Colombia.
In 2024, Olise got an invitation to the Super Falcons and played against Algeria in a two-legged friendly match.
